newsitem.title: EGYPT: BP buys 50,000 t/mth Egypt fuel oil at +$7.76.
newsitem.headline: BP buys 50,000 t/mth Egypt fuel oil at +$7.76.

text.p: British Petroleum Co Plc has contracted to buy 50,000 tonnes a month of low sulphur fuel oil through 1997 from the state's Egyptian General Petroleum Corp (EGPC), a trader close to the deal said on Tuesday.
BP will pay Platts FOB Med mean +$7.76 a tonne, he said.

The BP contract accounts for about 60 percent of the amount EGPC wants to sell and EGPC has not yet decided on the award for the remainder, he added. An EGPC committee may take a decision later on Tuesday, he said.
He said the Italian state power firm Enel and Bakri Trading were in the running for the other contracts.
"The validity of the BP offer has expired so I don't expect BP will be buying the rest," he added.
